# The `UnicodeCharSet` Class Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

Holds a reference to an ordered array of <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/sys/unicodecharrange">UnicodeCharRange</a> and allows to quickly check if a code point is contained in the set represented by this array. <a href="#details">More...</a>

## Declaration

<CodeBlock>class llvm::sys::UnicodeCharSet</CodeBlock>

## Description {#details}

Holds a reference to an ordered array of <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/sys/unicodecharrange">UnicodeCharRange</a> and allows to quickly check if a code point is contained in the set represented by this array.

Definition at line 38 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/unicodecharranges-h">UnicodeCharRanges.h</a>.

## Public Constructors

### UnicodeCharSet() {#a90c7be75d8be840b2eb855fb6767aef3}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>llvm::sys::UnicodeCharSet::UnicodeCharSet (<a href="#a85ed61bb536a499e1544c955db93086d">CharRanges</a> Ranges)</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Constructs a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sys/unicodecharset">UnicodeCharSet</a> instance from an array of UnicodeCharRanges.

Array pointed by <code>Ranges</code> should have the lifetime at least as long as the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sys/unicodecharset">UnicodeCharSet</a> instance, and should not change. Array is validated by the constructor, so it makes sense to create as few <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sys/unicodecharset">UnicodeCharSet</a> instances per each array of ranges, as possible.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/unicodecharranges-h/#l00057">57</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/unicodecharranges-h">UnicodeCharRanges.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

</SectionDefinition>

Returns true if each of the ranges is a proper closed range &#91;min, max&#93;, and if the ranges themselves are ordered and non-overlapping.
